thread.title: Four Tornadoes Hit Southern Illinois on Wednesday According to Preliminary Survey Results | Weather | wsiltv.com
thread.title_full: Four Tornadoes Hit Southern Illinois on Wednesday According to Preliminary Survey Results | Weather | wsiltv.com

author: : Mike Mohundro
title: Four Tornadoes Hit Southern Illinois on Wednesday According to Preliminary Survey Results | Weather | wsiltv.com
text:
CARBONDALE, Ill. -- Four tornadoes touched down in southern Illinois on Wednesday, according to preliminary survey reports.
The National Weather Service surveyed areas on Thursday in the region after storms swept through on Wednesday.
Preliminary surveys were conducted mostly in the southern Illinois area on Thursday where many tornado and severe thunderstorm warnings occurred.
Here is a list of the preliminary survey resultsâ€¦
Williamson County
Lake of Egypt area EF-0 Estimated peak winds at 80 mph Max width 25 yards Path length 6.61 miles Jackson/Williamson County
Southeast of Carbondale EF-1 Estimated peak winds at 90 mph Max Width 50 yards Path length 4.58 miles Jackson County
Near Cora EF-1 Estimate peak winds at 108 mph Max width 100 yards Path length 1.25 miles 1 injury Saline County
Carrier Mills area EF-1 Estimated Peak Winds at 95 mph Max width 150 yards Path length 7.83 miles More surveys are anticipated in areas across the region in the coming days.
